name: RoboTrapper
description:
This game was originally released on 2012/08/29 on the Android Market (subsequently the Play store), and was my second released game. It was auto-removed at some point because I never specified if it was "child-directed". It's hosted here so that no matter what Google decides, this ancient game can remain available.

RoboTrapper is a game wherein the player springs traps on enemy robots as they try to make their way to the center of the map. It features ten levels, two dozen types of traps, and six types of enemies. The game's core loop focuses on engaging traps at just the right moments, across the entire screen.

This game broke my desire to make games at all, it's awful and I stopped creating for two years as a result of it. Please don't play it, it's boring and bad (that's not a clever ruse to get you to want to play, it really is boring and bad).
